title: Turn Left at Lenin’s Statue: Travels in Central Asia
description: Larger than Europe, Central Asia has been a crucible of empires and culture that influenced the world for centuries. Today, after the end of almost a century of Soviet domination, it is a land at best ignored. On trains, planes and hitching rides on passing trucks, Fabrizio Soggetto travels from the icy Kazakh steppe to the Transoxiana deserts, visiting ancient Jewish communities, outlandish nomadic camps and the dystopian reality of Xinjiang, his aim to discover Central Asia beyond headlines and caricature.Turn Left at Lenin’s Statue is a loving portrait of peoples and lands of profound beauty.
author: Fabrizio Soggetto
